item.title: Julie add a quote by Joyce Meyer (Author)
item.description: "Happiness is not a feeling, it is a choice. To be happy, one must choose to be happy, not respond to a circumstance that now controls your happiness." -- Joyce Meyer (Author)

item.title: Julie add a quote by Frances Mayes
item.description: "Although I am a person who expected to be rooted in one spot forever, as it has turned out I love having the memories of living in many places." -- Frances Mayes

item.title: Julie add a quote by Mary Kay Ash
item.description: "The greatest polution problem we face today is negativity. " -- Mary Kay Ash

item.title: Julie add a quote by Mary Kay Ash
item.description: "Aerodynamically, the bumble bee shouldn't be able to fly, but the bumble bee doesn't know it so it goes on flying anyway." -- Mary Kay Ash

item.title: Julie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Julie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Julie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Julie add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Julie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The Christian does not think God will love us because we are good, but that God will make us good because He loves us." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Julie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A children's story that can only be enjoyed by children is not a good children's story in the slightest." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Julie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If we find ourselves with a desire that nothing in this world can satisfy, the most probable explanation is that we were made for another world." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Julie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If you look for truth, you may find comfort in the end; if you look for comfort you will not get either comfort or truth only soft soap and wishful thinking to begin, and in the end, despair." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Julie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "[God] will not be used as a convenience. Men or nations who think they can revive the Faith in order to make a good society might just as well think they can use the stairs of heaven as a shortcut to the nearest chemist's shop." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Julie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Now the trouble about trying to make yourself stupider than you really are is that you very often succeed." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Julie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The stamp of the Saint is that he can waive his own rights and obey the Lord Jesus." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Julie add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "Child, you have to learn to see things in the right proportions. Learn to see great things great and small things small." -- Corrie Ten Boom

item.title: Julie add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "Forgiveness is an act of the will, and the will can function regardless of the temperature of the heart." -- Corrie Ten Boom

item.title: Julie add a quote by Sophie Kinsella
item.description: "sometimes you don't need a goal in life, you don't need to know the big picture. you just need to know what you're going to do next!" -- Sophie Kinsella

item.title: Julie add a quote by Coco Chanel
item.description: "In order to be irreplaceacle, one must always be different." -- Coco Chanel

item.title: Julie add a quote by Coco Chanel
item.description: "A girl should be two things: classy and fabulous." -- Coco Chanel

item.title: Julie add a quote by Coco Chanel
item.description: "You live but once; you might as well be amusing." -- Coco Chanel

item.title: Julie add a quote by Coco Chanel
item.description: "A woman who doesn't wear perfume has no future." -- Coco Chanel

item.title: Julie add a quote by Coco Chanel
item.description: "Dress shabbily and they remember the dress; dress impeccably and they remember the woman." -- Coco Chanel

item.title: Julie add a quote by Coco Chanel
item.description: "The most courageous act is still to think for yourself. Aloud." -- Coco Chanel

item.title: Julie add a quote by Coco Chanel
item.description: "Success is most often achieved by those who don't know that failure is inevitable." -- Coco Chanel

item.title: Julie add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Julie add a quote by Coco Chanel
item.description: "If you were born without wings, do nothing to prevent them from growing." -- Coco Chanel

item.title: Julie add a quote by Coco Chanel
item.description: "Everyone marries the Duke of Westminster. There are a lot of duchesses, but only one Coco Chanel." -- Coco Chanel

item.title: Julie add a quote by Coco Chanel
item.description: "I wanted to give a woman comfortable clothes that would flow with her body. A woman is closest to being naked when she is well-dressed." -- Coco Chanel

item.title: Julie add a quote by Coco Chanel
item.description: "Arrogance is in everything I do. It is in my gestures, the harshness of my voice, in the glow of my gaze, in my sinewy, tormented face." -- Coco Chanel
